summary: innate immunity works by detecting pathogen-associated molecular patterns on invading viruses. all TLRs have N-terminal leucine-rich repeats that recognize pathogens and a C-terminal toll-interleukin-1 receptor (TIR) domain that mediates intracellular signaling to downstream TIR domain-containing adaptors. myD88 inhibits hepatitis B virus replication and restricts west Nile virus replication and spread in central nervous system neurons (29, 30) myD88 promotes adaptive immunity and enhances the CD8 T cell responses to vaccinia virus (31–33). virions are produced to regulate cellular signaling pathways with high expression of viral genes. high levels of RTA transcripts are detected within 2 h postinfection, followed by a dramatic decline 24 h later (41). During latency, a few gene products are expressed to limit the number of antigens that can be sensed by the immune system. RTA possesses ubiquitin (Ub) E3 ligase activity and targets IRF7 for proteasome-mediated degradation. RTA also degrades TRIF through the ubiquitin-proteasome pathway to suppress double-stranded RNA-initiated activation of TLR-3 signaling. s were amplified from a BCBL1 cell cDNA library, inserted into pCMV-hemagglutinin (HA) at EcoRI and KpnI sites. pCR3.1-RTA encodes the full-length RTA. s were subcloned into the expression vector pCDH-flag. BL21 Escherichia coli cells were transformed with the plasmid construct GST-MyD88 or glutathione S-transferase (GST) cells were induced with 2 mM isopropyl-B-d-thiogalactopyranoside for 16 h. cells were harvested and sonicated, and proteins were solubilized in PBS with PMSF. the multiplicity of infection (MOI) was determined from GFP-positive cells. the infection of TRE-BCBL1-RTA cells was the same as that for HUVECs. flag-empty vector or Flag-WT RTA was transfected into HEK293T cells. beads were washed three times with RIPA buffer. GST-MyD88 protein was prepared as described for GST pulldown assays. ubiquitin ligase site mutant constructs C131S and C141S were generated using the pCDH-flag-RTA plasmid as a template with the QuikChange site-directed mutagenesis kit. pCDH-flag-RTA plasmid was used as a template with the QuikChange site-directed mutagenesis kit (Stratagene) CAT Actin-R GTCAGGCAGCTCGTAGCTCTT IFN1-F TGTTTTCATGTTGGACCAGATG IFN2-F CCTGATGAAGGAGGACTCCATT IFN2-R AAAAAGGTGAGCTGGCATACG IFN-F AGTGTCAGAAGCTCG IFN-R TGTCAGCTCG IFN-R TGTCAGCTCG IFN2-R. iSLK cells harboring wild-type (WT) BAC16 were gifts from the university of south California, los Angeles, CA. iSLK cells were grown in RPMI 1640 medium (HyClone) and Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium (DMEM) (HyClone) all cells were cultured in EGM-2 (Lonza) small interfering RNA (siRNA) of MyD88 and negative-control green fluorescent protein were from GenePharma. Strep-Tactin Sepharose (IBA) and flag M2 Sepharose were from Sigma. nickel-nitrilotriacetic acid was from Qiagen. 293T cells in 10-cm dishes were transfected with pCDH-RTA and/or pCMV-HA-MyD88. cells were lysed in radioimmunoprecipitation assay (RIPA) cell lysis buffer. five percent of the cell lysate was taken as the input. GST-Sepharose beads were incubated with 1 mM PMSF at 4°C. pCR3.1-RTA was translated in vitro with a TNT-coupled transcription/translation system. iSLK cells harboring WT BAC16 were induced with 1 g/ml DOX for 5 days. well-grown TRE-BCBL1-RTA cells were induced by 1 g/ml DOX. cells were treated with 10 M MG132 for 24 h and lysed with denaturing lysis buffer. nM UBE1, 1 g GST-MyD88, 2 mM DTT, 2 mM energy regenerating solution containing ATP, and 5 mM MgCl2 in ubiquitination buffer for 1 h at 37°C. RESULTS RTA downregulates MyD88 expression. RTA decreased the level of endogenous MyD88 in a dose-dependent manner. iSLK cells were induced by DOX to induce RTA expression. qRT-PCR results showed that RTA did not change the MyD88 mRNA level. RNA was collected for reverse transcription and used to quantify MyD88 and actin by qRT-PCR. RTA alters MyD88 stability and degrades MyD88 through the proteasome pathway. previous experiments showed that RTA did not regulate MyD88 at the posttranscriptional level. anti-flag and anti-HA antibodies were used for Western blotting. values are calculated from the experiments shown in panel A. signal intensities first were normalized to the corresponding tubulin value and then normalized to the signal at 0 h. 293T cells were cotransfected with strep-tagged MyD88, His-tagged ubiquitin, and pCR3.1-RTA. after 24 h, cells were treated with MG132 for 16 h. RTA antibody coimmunoprecipitated endogenous MyD88 from the cells with DOX induction but not from the cells without induction. we further tested whether RTA bound to MyD88 directly. RTA synthesized in vitro interacted with full-length MyD88 fused with GST immobilized on glutathione-Sepharose beads. bacterially expressed GST alone and GST-MyD88 attached to beads were incubated with in vitro-translated RTA (lane 1). RTA binding to beads was detected by Western blotting. a previous study reported that RTA has E3 ligase activity. 293T cells were cotransfected with HA-tagged MyD88, WT RTA, and RTA mutants. proteins were collected for Western blotting. expression of MyD88 is impaired at early stages of primary de novo infection. KSHV miR-K5 was reported to inhibit MyD88 expression 7 days after KSHV infection of human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs) miR-K5 was expressed at a very low level 2 h and 6 h after KSHV infection, while it increased highly at 24 h. TRE-BCBL1-RTA cells were induced with DOX for 24 h and 48 h. RNA from BCBL1 cells was a positive control. TRE-BCBL1-RTA cells were mock induced or DOX induced for 24 h and 48 h. Western blotting was used to detect MyD88 expression. p65 was stable in all samples, while p-p65 was activated in the presence of MyD88 at about 30 min after LPS stimulation. RTA appearance also inhibited the activation of p-IRF3. effects of RTA on myD88-induced expression from luciferase genes driven by NF-B and IFN- promoters. luciferase activity shown as fold changes over basal levels obtained with control vector DNA without LPS stimulation. RNA was collected for testing the TLR4 mRNA level by qRT-PCR. MyD88 promotes IFN production and inhibits KSHV latent gene transcription during KSHV de novo infection. primary HUVECs were infected with KSHV after transfection with siRNA. primary HUVECs were transfected with the first MyD88 siRNA and with GFP siRNA (siGFP) as a control. after 36 h, cells were infected with KSHV (MOI, 4) RNA was collected to analyze IFN- mRNA levels. RNA was collected over a time course to analyze LANA-1 transcription. protein was analyzed by Western blotting to show MyD88 overexpression. RTA downregulates MyD88 expression. RTA decreased the level of endogenous MyD88 in a dose-dependent manner. iSLK cells were induced by DOX to induce RTA expression. qRT-PCR results showed that RTA did not change the MyD88 mRNA level. s represent percentages of MyD88 proteins normalized against tubulin. after 36 h, RNA was collected for reverse transcription. RTA alters MyD88 stability and degrades MyD88 through the proteasome pathway. anti-flag and anti-HA antibodies were used for Western blotting. values are calculated from the experiments shown in panel A. signal intensities first were normalized to the corresponding tubulin value and then normalized to the signal at 0 h of each group. 293T cells were cotransfected with strep-tagged MyD88, His-tagged ubiquitin, and pCR3.1-RTA. after 24 h, cells were treated with MG132 for 16 h. RTA antibody coimmunoprecipitated endogenous MyD88 from the cells with DOX induction but not from the cells without induction. RTA synthesized in vitro interacted with full-length MyD88 fused with GST immobilized on glutathione-Sepharose beads. blotting with anti-MyD88 antibody detected GST affinity binding. bacterially expressed GST alone and GST-MyD88 attached to beads were incubated with in vitro-translated RTA (lane 1). 145 failed to produce polyUb-conjugated bands that were as rich as those of wild-type RTA. results indicated that RTA functioned as an E3 Ub-ligase for MyD88. 293T cells were cotransfected with HA-tagged MyD88, WT RTA, and RTA mutants. KSHV miR-K5 was reported to inhibit MyD88 expression 7 days after KSHV infection of human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs) miR-K5 was expressed at a very low level 2 h and 6 h after KSHV infection, while it increased highly at 24 h. RNA was collected for testing the KSHV miR-K5 level by qRT-PCR. TRE-BCBL1-RTA cells were mock induced or DOX induced for 24 h and 48 h. Western blotting was used to detect MyD88 expression. p65 was stable in all samples, while p-p65 was activated in the presence of MyD88 at about 30 min after LPS stimulation. RTA appearance also inhibited the activation of p-IRF3. p-p65 was not increased by MyD88 overexpression with TNF- stimulation. luciferase cells were transfected with NF-B-luciferase and IFN--luciferase plasmids for 24 h, followed by stimulation with 800 ng/ml LPS for 12 h before luciferase assays. iSLK cells were induced by DOX for RTA expression for 24 h. RNA was collected for testing the TLR4 mRNA level by qRT-PCR. MyD88 promotes IFN production and inhibits KSHV latent gene transcription during KSHV de novo infection. primary HUVECs were transfected with myD88 siRNA and siGFP as a control. after 36 h, cells were infected with KSHV (MOI, 4) RNA was collected to analyze myD88 and IFN mRNA levels. RNA was collected over a time course to analyze LANA-1 transcription. proteins were analyzed by Western blotting to show MyD88 overexpression. DISCUSSION TLRs are important in microbe recognition. our results describe an efficient strategy for KSHV to impair the transmission of TLR signals by degrading the adaptor MyD88. a previous study found that KSHV infection of endothelial cells suppressed TLR4 transcription by viral G protein-coupled receptor (vGPCR), vIRF4 and ERK signaling (65), we also checked the TLR4 mRNA level in KSHV-infected primary HUVECs. ICP0 reduces MyD88 levels (74) but the mechanism by which ICP0 reduces MyD88 levels is unknown. a previous study found that MyD88 is downregulated by miR-K5 of KSHV 7 days after the infection. miR-K5 was expressed weakly at 2 h and 6 h postinfection. the expression increased as high as 20 times at 24 h compared with that at 2 h. this result suggested that miR-K5 levels were too low to repress MyD88.
